content:
FontDialogArray Class

Definition

Provides a control array of FontDialog controls.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.ProvideProperty("Index", typeof(System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog))]
[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
public class FontDialogArray : Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray, System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider

Object

Component

Remarks

The FontDialogArray class provides an equivalent for the run-time functionality of a Visual Basic 6.0 FontDialog array. It does not provide the design-time features of a Visual Basic 6.0 control array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Constructors

FontDialogArray()

Initializes a new instance of the FontDialogArray class.

public FontDialogArray ();

Remarks

When you instantiate a FontDialogArray, you must also call the SetIndex method to create the initial element in the array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

FontDialogArray(IContainer)

Initializes a new instance of the FontDialogArray class, specifying its container.

public FontDialogArray (System.ComponentModel.IContainer Container);
Container
IContainer

The IContainer where the control array will be hosted.

Remarks

When you instantiate a FontDialogArray, you must also call the SetIndex method to create the initial element in the array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Properties

Item(Int16)

Gets a specific element of a FontDialogArray by index. Read-only.

public System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog this[short Index] { get; }
Index
Int16

A Short that specifies the position of an element of the control array.

Value
FontDialog

A FontDialog at the specified Index in the control array.

Remarks

The Item property is the default property for a control array. Therefore, the following lines of code are equivalent. 

MsgBox(CStr(FontDialogArray.Item(1).Text))  
MsgBox(CStr(FontDialogArray(1).Text))
Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Methods

CanExtend(Object)

Gets a value that determines whether a control is a member of a FontDialogArray.

public bool CanExtend (object target);
target
Object

A FontDialog control.

Returns
Boolean

true if target is a member of the control array; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The CanExtend method can be used to determine whether a specific FontDialog control is the base element of the control array from which the other elements were cloned.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

GetControlInstanceType()

Overrides crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.GetControlInstanceType*.

protected override Type GetControlInstanceType ();
Returns
Type

The type of a control in a control array.

Remarks

This method cannot be called from your application's code. Use the GetType method instead.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

GetIndex(FontDialog)

Gets the index of a FontDialog in a FontDialogArray.

public short GetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog o);
o
FontDialog

A FontDialog in the control array.

Returns
Int16

A Short that represents the index of the specified FontDialog.

Remarks

This method can be used to retrieve the index for the selected FontDialog.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

HookUpControlEvents(Object)

Overrides crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.HookUpControlEvents*.

protected override void HookUpControlEvents (object o);
o
Object

An Object.

Remarks

This method cannot be called from your application's code. Use AddHandler to hook up events for any controls that are added by using the Load method.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

ResetIndex(FontDialog)

The ResetIndex method is not supported in the FontDialogArray class.

public void ResetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog o);
o
FontDialog

A Control.

Remarks

This method is not supported, and calling it does not raise an exception.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

SetIndex(FontDialog,Int16)

Sets the index of the initial FontDialog in a FontDialogArray.

public void SetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog o, short Index);
o
FontDialog

A FontDialog in the control array.

Index
Int16

A Short that represents the index of the specified FontDialog.

Remarks

The SetIndex method should only be called when you are creating the initial element in the control array. To add subsequent elements, call the Load method and specify the Index.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

ShouldSerializeIndex(FontDialog)

Returns a value that indicates whether a FontDialog is a member of this FontDialogArray.

public bool ShouldSerializeIndex (System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog o);
o
FontDialog

A FontDialog in the control array.

Returns
Boolean

true if o is a member of this control array; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If the specified FontDialog is a member of a different FontDialogArray, ShouldSerializeIndex returns false.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Events

Apply

Occurs when the user clicks the Apply button in the font dialog box.

public event EventHandler Apply;

Remarks

Every time the Apply button is clicked, another Apply event is raised.

For more information about how to handle events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

HelpRequest

Occurs when the user requests help for a control.

public event EventHandler HelpRequest;

Remarks

The HelpRequested event is typically raised when the user presses the F1 key or an associated context-sensitive Help button is clicked.

For more information about how to handle events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
